snippet: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.
abstract: Lawmakers in at least 20 states have introduced bills that would limit out-of-pocket payments by consumers for expensive drugs used to treat chronic diseases; bills aim to counter efforts by health plans to reduce the amount they pay for expensive medicines by making patients pay a percentage of the cost.
lead_paragraph: So-called specialty drugs for diseases like rheumatoid arthritis have a narrow use and high costs, leaving the most vulnerable patients with huge bills.

headline.seo: States Seek to Curb Exorbitant Drug Costs Incurred by Patients
headline.main: States Seek Curb on Patient Bills for Costly Drugs
headline.print_headline: States Seek Curb On Patient Bills For Costly Drugs
